Device.Name: LCSystem
Device.Description: LCSystem device. This is our master device.

Property.Name: Connected
Property.Description: Indicates whether the device is connected to the data system, i.e. under computer control. See also: Connect, Disconnect.

Command.Name: Connect
Command.Description: Connects the device to the data system, enables computer control. See also: Connected, Disconnect.

Command.Name: Disconnect
Command.Description: Disconnects the device from the data system, enables manual control from the device's front panel. See also: Connected, Connect.

Property.Name: _CommandQueueLevel
Property.Description: Shows the number of entries in the command queue

Property.Name: _PortQueueLevel
Property.Description: Shows the number of entries in the port queue

Property.Name: _ReplyQueueLevel
Property.Description: Shows the number of entries in the reply queue

Property.Name: _AuditQueueLevel
Property.Description: Shows the number of entries in the audit queue

Property.Name: _MaxLatencyToDriver
Property.Description: Shows the maximum latency of a command or property assignment in [ms].

Property.Name: _MaxLatencyFromDriver
Property.Description: Shows the maximum latency of a property update in [ms].

Property.Name: _AverageLatencyToDriver
Property.Description: Shows the average latency of a command or property assignment in [ms].

Property.Name: _AverageLatencyFromDriver
Property.Description: Shows the average latency of a property update in [ms].

Property.Name: _TraceLevel
Property.Description: Trace level configuration. Off = No tracing. Error = Trace error messages. Warning = Trace errors and warnings. Info = Trace errors, warnings and informational messages. Verbose = Output all trace messages.

Property.Name: _GcCollectionCount0
Property.Description: Returns the number of times garbage collection has occurred for the specified generation of objects.

Property.Name: _GcCollectionCount1
Property.Description: Returns the number of times garbage collection has occurred for the specified generation of objects.

Property.Name: _GcCollectionCount2
Property.Description: Returns the number of times garbage collection has occurred for the specified generation of objects.

Property.Name: Manufacturer
Property.Description: Manufacturer of the driver.

Property.Name: DriverManufacturer
Property.Description: Manufacturer of the driver.

Property.Name: DriverVersion
Property.Description: Version of the driver.

Property.Name: DeviceType
Property.Description: The DeviceType property tells us which component we are talking to.

Property.Name: DriverID
Property.Description: Unique Driver Identifier.

Property.Name: DeviceType
Property.Description: The DeviceType property tells us which component we are talking to.

Property.Name: Nominal
Property.Description: Sets and displays the nominal value of this parameter.

Property.Name: Value
Property.Description: Displays the actual value of this parameter.

Struct.Name: %A
Struct.Description: Partial flow of this component, expressed in percent of the total flow.

Property.Name: Value
Property.Description: Partial flow of this component, expressed in percent of the total flow.

Property.Name: Equate
Property.Description: User-selectable designation of this solvent component.

Struct.Name: %B
Struct.Description: Partial flow of this component, expressed in percent of the total flow.

Property.Name: Value
Property.Description: Partial flow of this component, expressed in percent of the total flow.

Property.Name: Equate
Property.Description: User-selectable designation of this solvent component.

Struct.Name: %C
Struct.Description: Partial flow of this component, expressed in percent of the total flow.

Property.Name: Value
Property.Description: Partial flow of this component, expressed in percent of the total flow.

Property.Name: Equate
Property.Description: User-selectable designation of this solvent component.

Struct.Name: %D
Struct.Description: Partial flow of this component, expressed in percent of the total flow.

Property.Name: Value
Property.Description: Partial flow of this component, expressed in percent of the total flow.

Property.Name: Equate
Property.Description: User-selectable designation of this solvent component.

Property.Name: DeviceType
Property.Description: The DeviceType property tells us which component we are talking to.

Command.Name: Inject
Command.Description: Injects a sample.

Property.Name: Volume
Property.Description: The injection volume.

Property.Name: Position
Property.Description: The sample's position on the sample tray.

Property.Name: Ready
Property.Description: Indicates that the module is ready for the next injection.

Command.Name: AcqOn
Command.Description: Begin data acquisition.

Command.Name: AcqOff
Command.Description: Terminate data acquisition.

Property.Name: Delta
Property.Description: The signal's slope. Useful for triggers. (Difference between current value and value one second ago.)

Property.Name: Signal
Property.Description: The current signal value.

Property.Name: Retention
Property.Description: The signal's retention time.

Property.Name: DeviceType
Property.Description: The DeviceType property tells us which component we are talking to.

Property.Name: Wavelength
Property.Description: The wavelength at which the channel measures the signal. See also: Bandwidth.

Device.Name: System
Device.Description: The "System" device contains commands and properties for the entire instrument. It is always available and can't be seen in Chromeleon Instrument Configuration Manager.

Command.Name: WriteReportMacro
Command.Description: Writes a report macro definition to the audit trail.

Parameter.Name: Name
Parameter.Description: Name of the report macro. At dedicated places in report definition files, this name (preceded by a dollar character) will be replaced by the value text.

Parameter.Name: Value
Parameter.Description: Value of the report macro. At dedicated places in report definition files, the macro name (preceded by a dollar character) will be replaced by this text.

Command.Name: PlotMarker
Command.Description: Adds a chromatogram or spectrum plot marker to the audit trail.

Parameter.Name: MarkerString
Parameter.Description: Description of the plot marker.

Command.Name: RespondToMessage
Command.Description: If a Message command is currently executing, indicate that the user has clicked "OK". (This command is automatically used by the system, and should not be used normally)

Parameter.Name: MessageID
Parameter.Description: If a Message command is currently executing, the internal id of the message.

Property.Name: MessageID
Property.Description: If a Message command is currently executing, the internal id of the message.

Property.Name: MessageText
Property.Description: If a Message command is currently executing, the message text.

Property.Name: CurrentStage
Property.Description: The current instrument method stage.

Property.Name: TotalFluidics
Property.Description: Represents the current fluidic setup of the instrument.

Property.Name: Fluidics
Property.Description: Represents the current fluidic setup of the instrument.

Property.Name: DiagnosticsState
Property.Description: State of diagnostics.

Command.Name: StartDiagnostics
Command.Description: Start a diagnostic run.

Parameter.Name: DeviceName
Parameter.Description: Name of the device that is tested in the diagnostics run.

Parameter.Name: TestName
Parameter.Description: Name of the diagnostics test.

Command.Name: EndDiagnostics
Command.Description: End a diagnostic run.

Parameter.Name: Mode
Parameter.Description: Normally finish or abort diagnostics.

Command.Name: Sound
Command.Description: Plays a sound (on the instrument controller). Note: Not supported on Windows XP (64 bit), Windows Vista and Windows 7.

Parameter.Name: File
Parameter.Description: The name of the sound file (*.wav, usually found in the Windows directory). If no parameters are specified, all sounds stop. Note: Not supported on Windows XP (64 bit), Windows Vista and Windows 7.

Parameter.Name: Frequency
Parameter.Description: The frequency of a sound to play. If no parameters are specified, all sounds stop. Note: Not supported on Windows XP (64 bit), Windows Vista and Windows 7.

Parameter.Name: Duration
Parameter.Description: The duration of a sound to play. If no parameters are specified, all sounds stop. Note: Not supported on Windows XP (64 bit), Windows Vista and Windows 7.

Command.Name: DebugBreak
Command.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Command.Name: ConsumableChanged
Command.Description: Record a consumable change event.

Parameter.Name: Comment
Parameter.Description: Enter a comment for this event.

Command.Name: EluentChanged
Command.Description: Record an eluent change event.

Parameter.Name: Comment
Parameter.Description: Enter a comment for this event.

Command.Name: AbortInjection
Command.Description: Terminates data acquisition and aborts the current injection. The queue processing continues with the next injection.

Command.Name: AbortQueue
Command.Description: Terminates data acquisition and aborts the current sequence queue run.

Command.Name: StopFlow
Command.Description: Enter stop mode.

Command.Name: Hold
Command.Description: Enter hold mode.

Command.Name: Continue
Command.Description: End hold mode.

Command.Name: AcqOff
Command.Description: End data acquisition on all channels.

Command.Name: AcqOn
Command.Description: Turn acquisition on for all installed and initialized channels.

Command.Name: StartManualAcquisition
Command.Description: Starts baseline monitoring.

Property.Name: HeapDump
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: UpdateTicks
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: LargestFreeBlock
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: CumulatedCount
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: CumulatedBytes
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: MaxCount
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: MaxBytes
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: FreeCount
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: FreeBytes
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: UsedCount
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: UsedBytes
Property.Description: This property shows internal debugging information. Only available in the debug version.

Property.Name: LicenseMode
Property.Description: Indicates the license mode.

Property.Name: LicenseServerNFPMode
Property.Description: "On" if the License Server could not be reached due to network problems. This Instrument Controller is using a locally cached license.

Property.Name: RequiredLicenseClass
Property.Description: Indicates the required license class for this instrument.

Property.Name: Class1Licenses
Property.Description: This property shows internal information. Don't care about it.

Property.Name: Class2Licenses
Property.Description: This property shows internal information. Don't care about it.

Property.Name: Class3Licenses
Property.Description: This property shows internal information. Don't care about it.

Property.Name: InstrumentControllerLicensed
Property.Description: Indicates whether the license "Instrument Controller" is enabled for the instrument controller.

Property.Name: FractionCollectionLicensed
Property.Description: Indicates whether the license "Fraction Collection" is enabled for the instrument controller.

Property.Name: 3DDataAcquisitionLicensed
Property.Description: Indicates whether the license "3D Data Acquisition" is enabled for the instrument controller.

Property.Name: ICControlSELicensed
Property.Description: Indicates whether the license "IC Control SE" is enabled for the instrument controller.

Property.Name: ICS2x00GradientGenerationLicensed
Property.Description: Indicates whether the license "ICS-2x00 Gradient Generation" is enabled for the instrument controller.

Property.Name: DDKDevelopmentLicensed
Property.Description: Indicates whether the license "DDK Development" is enabled for the instrument controller.

Property.Name: SingleQuadTripleQuadGCMSLicensed
Property.Description: Indicates whether the single quad and triple quad GC-MS license is enabled for the instrument controller.

Property.Name: LCMSLicensed
Property.Description: Indicates whether the LC-MS license is enabled for the instrument controller.

Property.Name: HomeDirectory
Property.Description: The home folder of the instrument. E.g. the instrument audit trails are stored in this folder.

Property.Name: UserId
Property.Description: The ID of the user who controls the instrument.

Property.Name: UserFullName
Property.Description: The full name of the user who controls the instrument.

Property.Name: UserName
Property.Description: The log on name of the user who controls the instrument.

Property.Name: Version
Property.Description: The Chromeleon version, including service pack.

Property.Name: ComputerName
Property.Description: The computer name of the Chromeleon Instrument Controller.

Property.Name: TimeZoneName
Property.Description: The current time zone.

Property.Name: TimeZoneOffset
Property.Description: The offset of local time to universal coordinated time (UTC), according to current time zone. This does not include daylight savings time. I.e.: Local time = UTC + <time zone offset> + <daylight offset>

Property.Name: DaylightOffset
Property.Description: The current daylight savings time offset to UTC. I.e.: Local time = UTC + <time zone offset> + <daylight offset>

Property.Name: SystemDriveFreeSpace
Property.Description: The amount of free space in GB available on the operating system drive.

Property.Name: SerialNo
Property.Description: The dongle serial number. Together with the license file, this determines which options are available.

Property.Name: OQMode
Property.Description: The OQ mode.

Property.Name: CMOQVersion
Property.Description: This property shows internal information. Don't care about it.

Property.Name: LineNo
Property.Description: The line number for the next command in the current instrument method.

Property.Name: LineId
Property.Description: The line ID of the next command in the current instrument method.

Property.Name: InstrumentName
Property.Description: The name of the instrument as specified in Chromeleon Instrument Configuration Manager.

Property.Name: InstrumentMethodEnd
Property.Description: The retention time of the last command of the current instrument method.

Property.Name: InstrumentMethodStart
Property.Description: The retention time of the first command of the current instrument method.

Property.Name: InstrumentMethodVersion
Property.Description: The version number of the current instrument method.

Property.Name: Retention
Property.Description: The retention time of the instrument.

Property.Name: InjectWait
Property.Description: Indicates whether the instrument is waiting for the inject response.

Property.Name: StopMode
Property.Description: Stop mode is like hold mode, but the flow is stopped.

Property.Name: HoldMode
Property.Description: Indicates whether the instrument is waiting, e.g. for an event or a CONTINUE command. In hold mode, the progress of retention time and gradients is suspended, but the flow continues.

Property.Name: StopQueue
Property.Description: The most urgent stop sequence queue request.

Property.Name: MethodKind
Property.Description: The kind of the (main) running, starting or stopping method.

Property.Name: MethodIsRunning
Property.Description: Indicates whether an instrument method or a script is running.

Property.Name: Acquisition
Property.Description: Indicates whether data acquisition is running. ACQUISITION ON/OFF turns all installed channels on or off.

Property.Name: AcquisitionControllerStatus
Property.Description: The status of the current acquisition controller.

Property.Name: PreparingInjectionID
Property.Description: The preparing injection ID, if available.

Property.Name: Analyzer
Property.Description: Indicates whether the analyzer controlling the instrument is ready for the next sample to run.

Property.Name: InstrumentControllerPrivateBytes
Property.Description: The number of allocated MB of the Instrument Controller process that cannot be shared with other processes.

Property.Name: InstrumentControllerVirtualSize
Property.Description: The virtual address space size of the Instrument Controller process in MB.

Property.Name: ServerStartTime
Property.Description: Time when the instrument controller service was started.

Property.Name: QueueStartTime
Property.Description: Time when the queue was started.

Property.Name: RemainingInjectionCount
Property.Description: The number of remaining idle, preparing or running injections that will be processed during this run.

Property.Name: InjectionCount
Property.Description: The total number of injections that are contained in the sequence.

Property.Name: RawDataDriveFreeSpace
Property.Description: The amount of free space in GB available on the drive where the raw data of the running sequence are stored.

Device.Name: PrevStandard
Device.Description: The last processed standard injection. Note: this is not necessarily a standard for the current injection!

Property.Name: InjectTime
Property.Description: Injection time.

Property.Name: NumberOfReinjections
Property.Description: The number of times the original injection has been re-injected.

Property.Name: AutoDilutionRatio
Property.Description: The ratio calculated by IRC for the automatic dilution of an injection.

Property.Name: _Volume
Property.Description: The injection volume.

Property.Name: _Position
Property.Description: The sample's position on the sample tray.

Property.Name: SpikeGroup
Property.Description: Spike group from the sequence table.

Property.Name: Level
Property.Description: Calibration level from the sequence table.

Property.Name: ReplicateID
Property.Description: Replicate ID from the sequence table.

Property.Name: IStdAmount
Property.Description: ISTD amount from the sequence table.

Property.Name: DilutionFactor
Property.Description: Dilution factor from the sequence table.

Property.Name: Weight
Property.Description: Injection weight from the sequence table.

Property.Name: Status
Property.Description: Injection status from the sequence table.

Property.Name: ProcessingMethod
Property.Description: The name of the processing method.

Property.Name: InstrumentMethod
Property.Description: The name of the injection instrument method.

Property.Name: Sequence
Property.Description: The sequence name (without path).

Property.Name: Type
Property.Description: The injection type (standard, unknown...).

Property.Name: Number
Property.Description: The injection number.

Property.Name: GUID
Property.Description: The globally unique ID of the injection run.

Property.Name: ID
Property.Description: The internal injection identification (unique in the sequence, never changing).

Property.Name: Comment
Property.Description: The injection comment.

Property.Name: Name
Property.Description: The injection name.

Property.Name: URL
Property.Description: The full internal designation of the injection.

Property.Name: LocalURL
Property.Description: The full local path of the injection. This is the URL in the XVault if the injection is downloaded.

Property.Name: InjectTime
Property.Description: Injection time.

Property.Name: NumberOfReinjections
Property.Description: The number of times the original injection has been re-injected.

Property.Name: AutoDilutionRatio
Property.Description: The ratio calculated by IRC for the automatic dilution of an injection.

Property.Name: _Volume
Property.Description: The injection volume.

Property.Description: The sample's position on the sample tray.

Device.Description: The next injection to run, if available.

Command.Name: Log
Command.Description: Writes any device property to the audit trail. Use this to document measured conditions, for example temperature, without using an A/D channel.

Parameter.Name: Property
Parameter.Description: The name of the property which you want to write to the audit trail.

Command.Name: Message
Command.Description: Shows a message to the operator, and waits until the operator clicks OK. Stops the instrument method time, the pump is in 'Hold' mode. But the acquisition is not stopped.

Parameter.Name: Text
Parameter.Description: To message which you want to display, e.g. "Make sure all vials are in their correct position". It will be written to the audit trail, too.

Command.Name: Protocol
Command.Description: Write an arbitrary message to the audit trail, e.g. experimental conditions you want to document.

Parameter.Name: Text
Parameter.Description: The message which you want to write to the audit trail.

Command.Name: Wait
Command.Description: Interrupt the instrument method until the condition changes from "false" to "true". 'Wait' stops the instrument method time, the pump is in 'Hold' mode. But the acquisition is not stopped.

Parameter.Name: Condition
Parameter.Description: The condition, when to resume instrument method execution. You can specify an input name or use expressions like (Input_1 AND NOT Input_2) OR (Pressure > 40).

Parameter.Name: Run
Parameter.Description: Whether retention time and gradients should be on hold or continue during the Wait command. (Default: Hold)

Parameter.Name: Timeout
Parameter.Description: The maximum time to wait for the condition to become true. If this time is exceeded, the injection will abort. (Default: Infinite)

Command.Name: Delay
Command.Description: Delays the execution of the following commands for the given time. Normally used only in triggers.

Parameter.Name: Delay
Parameter.Description: Delays the execution of the following commands for the given time. Normally used only in triggers.

Command.Name: VirtualChannel
Command.Description: Create a virtual channel and start the acquisition.

Parameter.Name: Name
Parameter.Description: The name of the virtual channel. It must be unique and different to any signal name.

Parameter.Name: Formula
Parameter.Description: The numeric expression that should be recorded. You can use formulas like (UV_VIS_1 / 1000) / (ColumnOven.Temperature * 10).

Parameter.Name: Type
Parameter.Description: The type of the virtual channel: - Use Analog (the default) to record a continuous curve like a detector signal or a temperature. - Use Digital if the numeric expression can result only in a few discrete values (e.g. in case of a relay state). The curve will consist of steps.

Parameter.Name: Unit
Parameter.Description: The unit of the virtual channel.

Parameter.Name: Evaluate
Parameter.Description: Indicates whether the signal is evaluated (peak detection and integration). The default is 'No'.

Command.Name: OnlineExtract
Command.Description: Create an online extract and start the acquisition.

Parameter.Name: Name
Parameter.Description: The name of the online extract. It must be unique and different to any signal name.

Parameter.Name: TraceType
Parameter.Description: The trace type that should be used for this online extract.

Parameter.Name: ScanFilter
Parameter.Description: The scan filter that should be used for this online extract.

Parameter.Name: SmoothingType
Parameter.Description: The smoothing type that should be used for this online extract.

Parameter.Name: SmoothingRange
Parameter.Description: The smoothing range that should be used for this online extract. Must be odd.

Parameter.Name: Unit
Parameter.Description: The unit of the online extract.

Parameter.Name: Evaluate
Parameter.Description: Indicates whether the signal is evaluated (peak detection and integration). The default is 'No'.

Parameter.Name: Persist
Parameter.Description: Indicates whether the signal should be persisted to a data vault. The default is 'No'.

Parameter.Name: MinMass
Parameter.Description: If the ScanFilter contains [MASSRANGE], this part of the filter expression will be replaced by [MinMass-MaxMass]

Parameter.Name: MaxMass
Parameter.Description: If the ScanFilter contains [MASSRANGE], this part of the filter expression will be replaced by [MinMass-MaxMass]

Command.Name: End
Command.Description: Marks the end of an instrument method.
